channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: SpaceX launches 11th test flight of its mega Starship rocket with another win
item.description: Starship, the biggest and most powerful rocket ever built, thundered into the evening sky from the southern tip of Texas.
item.content:encoded:
Starship, the biggest and most powerful rocket ever built, thundered into the evening sky from the southern tip of Texas.

(Image credit: Eric Gay)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Madagascar's president flees country in fear for his life after military rebellion
item.description: Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina called for dialogue "to find a way out of this situation" and said the constitution should be respected.
item.content:encoded:
Madagascar President Andry Rajoelina called for dialogue "to find a way out of this situation" and said the constitution should be respected.

(Image credit: Alexander Joe)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Marc Maron's last 'WTF' podcast episode, Obama offers advice on closing chapters
item.description: In the final episode, Marc Maron and former President Barack Obama spoke about the legacy of the podcast, politics and moving on.
item.content:encoded:
In the final episode, Marc Maron and former President Barack Obama spoke about the legacy of the podcast, politics and moving on.

(Image credit: Axelle/Bauer-Griffin)
item.dc:creator: Juliana Kim

item.title: Ecuador: The Andean reinvention of cumbia
item.description: Photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia music in Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina and the United States.
item.content:encoded:
Photographers and storytellers Karla Gachet and Ivan Kashinsky document cumbia music in Colombia, Mexico, Ecuador, Peru, Argentina and the United States.

(Image credit: Karla Gachet)
item.dc:creator: Karla Gachet

item.title: Ecuador: La reinvención andina de la cumbia
item.description: Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Perú, Argentina y Estados Unidos.
item.content:encoded:
Uno de los géneros más escuchados en las Américas, los fotógrafos Karla Gachet e Iván Kashinsky documentan la cumbia en Colombia, México, Ecuador, Perú, Argentina y Estados Unidos.

(Image credit: Karla Gachet)
item.dc:creator: Karla Gachet

item.title: Tackles, projectiles and gunfire: Many fear ICE tactics are growing more violent
item.description: Videos taken by eye witnesses of federal agent encounters with immigrants in Chicago and elsewhere have shown increasingly tense incidents. Immigrant advocates and observers say they're indicative of a larger trend of aggression among federal immigration officers.
item.content:encoded:
Videos taken by eye witnesses of federal agent encounters with immigrants in Chicago and elsewhere have shown increasingly tense incidents. Immigrant advocates and observers say they're indicative of a larger trend of aggression among federal immigration officers.

(Image credit: Armando L. Sanchez)
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: As the ceasefire begins, a look at the Gaza war by the numbers
item.description: With start of the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and release of hostages and prisoners, here are some key figures related to the Gaza war and the Hamas-led attack on Israel that sparked it.
item.content:encoded:
With start of the Israel-Hamas ceasefire and release of hostages and prisoners, here are some key figures related to the Gaza war and the Hamas-led attack on Israel that sparked it.

(Image credit: AFP)
item.dc:creator: NPR's International Desk

item.title: Palestinians celebrate as prisoners are released by Israel under Gaza ceasefire deal
item.description: Among the 2,000 Palestinians freed in the Gaza ceasefire deal were 250 serving life terms for attacks on Israelis dating back decades.
item.content:encoded:
Among the 2,000 Palestinians freed in the Gaza ceasefire deal were 250 serving life terms for attacks on Israelis dating back decades.

(Image credit: Majdi Mohammed)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Kids who use social media score lower on reading and memory tests, a study shows
item.description: Data from a large, ongoing study of adolescents shows a link between increasing social media use and lower cognition and memory in teens.
item.content:encoded: Data from a large, ongoing study of adolescents shows a link between increasing social media use and lower cognition and memory in teens.
item.dc:creator: Rhitu Chatterjee

item.title: This wedding photographer now removes landmines for a group that's won a top prize
item.description: The Mines Advisory Group has been removing landmines for more than three decades. This year, it received the Conrad N. Hilton Humanitarian Prize, a prestigious award with a $3 million prize.
item.content:encoded:
The Mines Advisory Group has been removing landmines for more than three decades. This year, it received the Conrad N. Hilton Humanitarian Prize, a prestigious award with a $3 million prize.

(Image credit: Sean Sutton)
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Lambert
